Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from anywhere can pick up and move — for the Netherlands, where citizens have lived in the same locale for centuries. The US population is definitely homogenised from an agrarian, feudal society, whereas the Dutch are a tight, tribal population without the velocity, yet merging. The US — though

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Universal’s epic treatment. Allen is also capable of some great moments of humour and he presents the complicated moral question of whether wars should be fought to end wars.
This film would make an excellent History Film Club choice and is a must watch for war film aficionados and history buffs.
